name: Make & Do Hong Kong - Sashiko Embroidery Workshop
location: WAKA artisans, 40 Upper Lascar Row Sheung Wan, HKI
about: Dates: 6th, 13th, 20th & 27th August Time: 7:00pm-9:00pmLocation: WAKA artisan, 40 Upper Lascar Row, Sheung WanPrice:4 workshops: $12003 workshops: $10502 workshops: $8001 workshop: $450Please email lucy.make.and.do.hk@gmail.com to confirm which dates you would like to join.Alternatively, you can book via our website: https://www.makeanddohk.com/workshop-booking/sashiko-embroideryPlaces are limitedCome and join Make and Do Hong Kong for our new 4 part Sashiko Embroidery Workshop.Over the course of the programme you will have the opportunity to participate in four diverse workshops, and you'll be able to take home a unique piece of work from each one.We look forward to creating something beautiful with you soon!Find out more about us hereWebsite: www.makeanddohk.comInstagram: @make.and.do.hk* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *Refund Policy: All tickets purchased for workshop events are final. Otherwise, we do not issue refunds or exchanges after the payment is made, so please make your purchase with this in mind. If you are no longer able to attend your workshop, you are welcome to find another person to take your seat. Please just make sure to inform us of the name change on the booking by emailing lucy.make.and.do.hk@gmail.com. Places are limited and will be allocated on a first come, first serve basis. Thank you for your understanding.

about: å‘¢å€‹èª²ç¨‹æœƒæ•™ä½ æŒæ¡Cricut Joy æ—¢æ“ä½œæŠ€å·§åŒ…æ‹¬ä»¥ä¸‹å…§å®¹ï¼šCricut Design SpaceåŸºæœ¬æ“ä½œåˆ‡å‰²ç¹ªç•«è£½ä½œè³€å¡å¤šå±¤è¨­è¨ˆå–®è‰²è† è²¼ç†±è½‰å°åˆ°å¸ƒè£½å“è€Œä¸”å®Œæˆèª²ç¨‹å¾Œï¼Œé‚„å¯äº«æœ‰*$120è²·æ©ŸæŠ˜æ‰£å„ªæƒ ï¼*å„ªæƒ éœ€æ–¼ä¸Šå®Œèª²å ‚å¾Œä¸€å€‹æœˆå…§ä½¿ç”¨ã€‚*ä¸èƒ½å’Œå…¶ä»–å„ªæƒ åŒæ™‚ä½¿ç”¨ã€‚å¦‚å°æ­¤èª²ç¨‹æˆ–é ç´„ä¸Šæœ‰ä»»ä½•æŸ¥è©¢ï¼Œè«‹é›»éƒµè‡³ï¼šsupport@steamaker.hkIn this class, We will show you how to handle the cricut machine basic function.Skill like :Basic routineCuttingDrawingCard makingMulti-layered Vinyl ProjectHeat transfer to fabricA HKD120 discount is given for any machine purchase with Sprintec Asia Ltd.This offer is valid within one-month from the issue date of this receipt.This offer cannot be redeemed with other promotional offersIf you want to make a booking ,please email to us : support@steamaker.hk

name: Candle-Making Workshop (Kids & Adults)
location: Hiraya Scent & Co. PMQ, 35è™Ÿ Aberdeen Street S412, 4th Floor, Block A Hong Kong, HKI
about: Learn the basics of candle making and let your creativity run wild with our selection of scents, unique marbling technique and selection of crystal chips.As a cherry on top - this workshop comes with complimentary, celebratory drinks once the candle has been poured and is solidifying. Wine not?More on the experience:We start with an exploration of scents where you are can select your pick of 2 or 3 fragrances to blend together in order to create your own signature scents. This is followed by the basics of candle making where we calculate oil to wax ratios in which we also discuss the properties of our sustainable and non-toxic Coconut Apricot Wax and Luxury Fragrance Oils.We then get to the exciting part where you get to choose your design, be it a solid color candle in 7 color options or a multi-color marbled design. This part is completely DIY so you can let your creativity lead you. Our experienced host(s) will assist you when you need it of course!Once the candles are poured, complimentary mulled wine or mulled wine tea will be served. You can then sit back and relax and watch our candle experts design your candle tops as you like it or for the brave souls - give it a go yourself!Optional DIY labels will be offered too. But if you're too mesmerised by your gorgeous marbling design, feel free to opt out!

name: Basic Plant Specimen Workshop
location: Dream Impact å¤¢å‰µæˆçœŸ, 4/F, 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road #Unit C Lai Chi Kok, KOW
about: Herbaria are at the core of botanical research, serving as permanent archives of invaluable plant information crucial for biodiversity, ecology, biogeography, evolution, conservation, and restoration efforts. Within each herbarium lies thousands to millions of preserved plant specimens, each carrying its own scientific significance, history, and natural beauty.But have you ever wondered what exactly a herbarium is, how itâ€™s organized, or how these specimens are made?In collaboration with Encompass HK and Pi Lab Limited, this hands-on workshop offers an introduction to the fundamentals of botany and plant specimen preparation. Guided by experts, youâ€™ll have the unique opportunity to create your very own herbarium specimenâ€”perfect to display at home or gift to loved onesâ€”while discovering how science and artistry come together in this timeless practice.The definition and purpose of a herbariumThe scientific and ecological importance of herbarium specimensMethods of collecting and preserving plant specimensCharacteristics of a high-quality specimenHow to document plants and their natural habitatsBasic principles of plant identificationKey features of Hong Kongâ€™s major plant familiesTechniques for distinguishing native from exotic plantsHow Hong Kongâ€™s native plant checklist is continually updatedThe significance of botanical Latin and scientific plant namesJoin us for an inspiring afternoon that blends science, nature, and creativityâ€”perfect for plant enthusiasts and curious minds alike!Remarks: Individuals with allergies to camphor or G6PD deficiency are advised not to participate in the workshop due to safety concerns.

name: 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair
location: Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, 1  Expo Drive Wan Chai, HKI
about: Welcome to the 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair!Meet over 50 leading law firms, professional legal organisations and law schools in Hong Kong - all gathered under one roof to offer you insights, guidance, and opportunities to connect with the legal profession.This is your chance to ask questions, explore career paths, and build networks that matter.Free admission is offered to penultimate LLB, double law degree and JD students. Law students from other years are also welcome to register for free admission, but is subject to availability.Non-law and LLM students are welcome to attend with a registration fee of HKD 500, and admission is subject to a quota.Registration is required to attend, and successful registrants will receive a QR code before the event.We look forward to seeing you at Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre!*In the event of adverse weather conditions (e.g. T8 or above, or a Black Rainstorm Signal), the Law Fair Committee will consider rescheduling the event to Sunday, 7 September 2025, subject to venue availability. Further details will be announced if this occurs.

name: The Justice Conference Asia 2025
location: The Vine Church, 29 Burrows St Hong Kong Island
about: The Justice Conference Asia returns to Hong Kong with a renewed vision and a steadfast commitment to advancing Godâ€™s heart for justice in our city and across the region. This yearâ€™s theme, Re-Imagine, invites us to challenge our imagination, disrupt our realities, and energise our actions for practical outcomes. We invite you to join us as we explore what it means to envision a world transformed by Godâ€™s boundless vision of human flourishing and justice.
